text: Pro rata is a Latin term that is used in law and economics. It is used to divide something by calculation or by a ratio. ==Etymology== Pro rata has a Latin etymology. It is from pro (according to, for, or by) and rata. Rata means "calculated" (rate or change).The Free Dictionary. Accessed May 29, 2008. ==Example== For example, the cost of a pizza can be divided pro rata depending on the number of slices each person ate. ==References== Category:Latin words and phrases Category:Economics
title: Pro rata
